alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 8:14AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yaak River Near Troy affecting Lincoln County. For the Yaak River...including Near Troy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yaak River Near Troy. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding affects low lying areas adjacent to the river. At 8.5 feet, Flooding affects low lying areas adjacent to the river including homes and access roads. Sylvanite Ranger Station Road and Upper Ford Road affected by flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.2 feet Friday, June 24. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 05/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM MDT.
